website_summaries.verdict: The Roku 1 offers the same excellent experience that's found on other Roku boxes at a new low price, but there aren't many reasons to choose it over the new Streaming Stick or step-up Roku boxes.
pros: The Roku 1 offers nearly the full Roku experience for $50
More than 1,200 channels are supported, including Netflix, Amazon Instant, HBO Go, Hulu Plus, Pandora, MLB.TV, Amazon Cloud Player, Vudu, and Showtime Anytime
It also has cross-platform search that scours several major TV and movie services to find content
cons: The new Roku Streaming Stick offers all the same functionality in an even smaller, more portable form factor
No dual-band wireless, which is available on every other Roku streaming box
And the official YouTube channel isn't scheduled to hit the Roku 1 until later this year

customer_reviews.title: Great little device.
customer_reviews.text: This came in handy when I moved out of my old place and realized I know longer had my roommate's PS3 to stream on anymore. I went low budget with the 1, because I wasn't sure if I was going to like it or if it was going to work with the old TV I was going to be using temporarily. But it works great, and is good for what it is. In hindsight, I would spring for the 3, because the 1 does not auto-play on Netflix, and I've gotten mixed answers on whether the 2 does or not. But for bottom of the line, this works just fine for Netflix, Hulu, Amazon, etc.
customer_reviews.author: leah-

customer_reviews.title: great little product!
customer_reviews.text: easy to use, easy to set up. If you lose the remote, there is a free app that serves as a remote which works just as well, but it's difficult to enter text into the text fields. Seems like the app should fix this easily (so for that it gets four stars)! Very strongly considering cutting cable as a function of all of the options that this Roku presents. Effectively renders any television into a Smart television, and the software works much more smoothly and faster than the software in most Smart TV interfaces (Samsung TV's especially clunky!)
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C. Flick

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, simple streamer, many apps
customer_reviews.text: I'm a BIG fan of apple products but when I was looking for a simple solution for someone less tech, I chose this instead of the competitor. I chose Roku because it has WAY more apps than the other items on the market and it's SO easy to use. It's just there when you turn on your TV, and if you don't have cable it's a great thing to have. Almost wish I had one of these instead of my usual. Thousands of available apps, including netfilx and amazon which are not available on others.
customer_reviews.author: bclmb

customer_reviews.title: Not Cost Efficient / Dependable
customer_reviews.text: Not as responsive as other Roku's I have; runs warm to hot. Ran OK for first three months; now it cuts off than on. Rebooting and other techniques have been unsuccessful in remedying the problem. Service, direction from Amazon - After the purchase - non existent!! Less expensive devices offer equal or better reception
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E Deutschle

customer_reviews.title: Buy an Updated Model
customer_reviews.text: This item is outdated technology, and will not work anywhere nearly as well as newer models available in the same price range. The Seller was unresponsive to my query as to why the item is slow to the point of Virtual Uselessness. If you want a DECENT streaming performance, then buy a newer model, such as the Roku Ultra or Roku Streaming Stick+ (as I finally did.)
customer_reviews.author: C. Dudley

customer_reviews.title: Zero technical support from Roku on either manufacter website via either chat or phone
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this December 2013 and it worked fine until complete failure a month ago. There is neither telephone nor live chat support on this device from ROKU. There is no way to access a screen to try reprogramming it. There is no button on the remote that can bring up any screen. Yes, I have powered it off and on again. After about 20 or so seconds of a Roku splash screen it goes dead and will not respond to any command. The HDMI cable works perfectly with other devices.
customer_reviews.author: J. Neil Schulman

customer_reviews.title: I love this version of the Roku
customer_reviews.text: I love this version of the Roku. Who needs constant, fancy new versions of things? It allows me to plug both my DVD player and roku into my TV. Now I have that and my Wii in the other room. I like this version of the Roku because it's fast and reliable. I bought one for my parents for Christmas and even they understand how to use it and very much enjoy it (since there's literally no where to rent DVDs in a store anymore)... you couldn't ask for a better buy.
customer_reviews.author: bearofdeath

customer_reviews.title: Unless you need SlingTV, get a NeoTV-200 for the same price of less.
customer_reviews.text: I own this, a Roku 3 and a Netgear NeoTV 200. The one is very simple, like earlier Smart TV and Devices. It does offer all the TV apps of a Roku2 or 3, but the apps themselves of very basic, making it hard to navigate, and not being able to you Profiles like in in Netflix. Its only saving grace is it has SlingTV. Not to be confused with Sling Box, and Slingplayer. The NeoTV 200 by Netgear does everything the Roku 1, 2 and 3 does except SlingTV, so if you have to have ESPN (on Sling TV), then get a Roku, otherwise NeoTV-200 is less expensive than the Roku 1.
customer_reviews.author: James Bates

customer_reviews.title: Remote Control had an attitude
customer_reviews.text: Bought to work with a non-HDMI TV . Good: Works well RCA/Componet input TV. Unit came with a component cable, a remote with batteries. Did provide good picture on projection TV. Bad: Remote control interface faulty ... Roku 1 failed to either respond when commanded via Remote, or, would uncontrollably scroll through multiple channels after single press of up/down button. Very frustrating experience. Returned to Amazon for refund - did not get another. Not sure if an isolated lemon, reason for 2 Star review. Note fwiw, I bought a Roku 2 a while back and it's been working flawlessly...
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Richards

customer_reviews.title: Great concept
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit to use with an older TV that lacked an HDMI port. I was pleased to see that it came with the cables iIn addition to the remote and Roku unit. Unfortunately, I believe I got a defective unit as a replacement SE model worked fine. Although I wish that the original product had worked, I was pleased with the great service from Amazon and the seller. Since another similar product worked on my tv, I would recommend the earlier Roku versions as a way to stream on older television.
customer_reviews.author: Carol F

customer_reviews.title: Great way to give new life to an older tv ...
customer_reviews.text: Great way to give new life to an older tv and bring it up to today's standards! We have several smart TVs in the house, but a few more that aren't. With the Roku streaming media player, I can stream Netflix, Hulu or Amazon video to those older TVs just as easily as I can to the smart TVs!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer C

customer_reviews.title: Great product to make your older TV smart!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Vary easy to set up, but I would suggest having your computer very close buy. I finally used my laptop as I sat in front of the TV setting things up keeping in mind that each subscription such as Netflix etc has to be set up before they can be used. Once set up every thing works great and is very reliable. Great solution for order Tv's to assentually make them smart.
customer_reviews.author: LB Hubert

customer_reviews.title: Stunning Device
customer_reviews.text: I have owned and used the original Roku device for more years than I can remember. I finally decided it was time to move up. I just purchased and setup the Roku 1. In a word - incredible! The setup was easy but I had to verify all my existing accounts: Netflix, Amazon, Pandora and TuneIn. The new remote is lightweight with great new features. The device itself has a faster processor and twice the memory of the original. The result: faster loading and maximum definition no matter what you watch. Another added benefit is I can listen to all the music in my Amazon Cloud: wow! All this for forty bucks!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Goldfield

customer_reviews.title: IT WOULD NOT "LINK" - BEWARE - IT SEEMS ALL ROKUS REQUIRE A CREDIT CARD TO ENABLE THE UNIT
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a friend who needed to have the composite (audio L-R and video) connections for his DVD recorder We did just fine up to trying to link the unit up to the Roku website. IT WOULD NOT LINK. After putting in all the required info, the webpage just kept saying it was "loading". Did this for 3 attempts using 3 "link codes" (They expire after a certain time, so the "loading" made each one expire). The last attempt we let it "load" for several hours - just kept "loading". Tried to find a 800 number or such to call ... no luck. So we wound up returning it.
customer_reviews.author: DabuckTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Good solution for those with broken SONY devices...
customer_reviews.text: Until only a few weeks ago, my parents accessed Netflix through the Netflix app on their Sony BDP-S580 blu-ray player. Recenently, Sony's "Provisioning Servers" have been down for weeks with no fix in sight so I bought this for my parents so they could continue to use Netflix. The Roku has many, many additional apps not available on the Sony which is a plus. We connected the Roku via wireless and with composite video. The picture is of course, not as good as going through HDMI or component but the Roku allows you to get streaming content on an old television (2004 Panasonic 42" plasma with (1) HDMI port).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Prime User

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately there seems to be no competitors for ROKU that get good reviews so I'm trying the ROKU 2
customer_reviews.text: I've just purchased a Roku 2 because the one simply didn't work properly. First of all it got very hot if I kept it plugged in. I also had to deal with a lot of buffering especially on the ACORN channel. When I contacted ROKU they asked me to do all sorts things that had nothing to do with the fact that the ROKU was not functioning. The finally said that they would send me a return label which they never did. Unfortunately there seems to be no competitors for ROKU that get good reviews so I'm trying the ROKU 2. I would suggest that anyone considering the ROKU 1 order the 2 instead.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Webb Varian

customer_reviews.title: Helps me watch movies
customer_reviews.text: I got this so I could watch Feeln a movie streaming channel. It was easy to install and I can watch movies not only on that channel but several others for free. There are some other channels that do have a fee if you so desire to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Natita Crane

customer_reviews.title: So easy to set up!
customer_reviews.text: Love my Roku. I purchased this and quite honestly it sat unopened for months. In my experience with electronics there always seems to be a proble that takes a lot of time and cursing, this has made me put off setting things up waiting for a time when I have time for the struggling and cursing. Those things can take serious time! I finally decided to bite the bullet and get my Roku set up and I wish I had done it months earlier. It was amazingly easy. I have been enjoying it for months now and I can honestly say there will always be a Roku in my life.
customer_reviews.author: Mysteri

customer_reviews.title: Excellent - portable from room to room
customer_reviews.text: Excellent - portable from room to room! Love this for my Netflix and even other sources of entertainment avenues now. The only things I'd say negative are that there are still a few limited features that you can't do from the actual unit ... You have to go to the computer to do them - (like organizing your Netflix lists, etc) - but that's probably on any streaming device. And this particular unit doesn't allow Netflix accounts to be switched in and out between each person's lists on the account, which other Roku players can actually do... We weren't aware of that until we already purchased it. But this is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Jeni

customer_reviews.title: Best Streaming Device
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this Roku device! It is so easy to set up and use, and it has been very reliable. I thought about purchasing the Roku stick (thumb drive size), however, after reading so many bad reviews of it I chose the Roku 1. I tried moving it from upstairs to a downstairs TV, and It simply worked flawlessly every time. I didn't have to repeat the setup procedure, the Roku remembered the password and settings without my having to repeat the process since I had moved it to a different TV and location. An excellent streaming device! I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: James Clark

customer_reviews.title: Problem solver
customer_reviews.text: When I discovered Pandora.com on my computer, I loved the fact that I could control music programming to exactly what I wanted to listen to and I can change it any time I like. I did not, however, want to be attached to my computer's location to listen to music. Roku resolved the problems completely. My TV and surround sound component system accepts the Roku easily - with a little help from tech services At Roku and my wireless router manufacturer (mostly my fault). This weekend I even changed my Netflix account to streaming so I can watch movies with the Roku as well..
customer_reviews.author: R. Bernhardt

customer_reviews.title: The picture quality is good for not being HD
customer_reviews.text: I got the Roku 1 because I have and older fat screen that doesn't have an HDMI connection. Have had it up and running about 2 weeks now, and have had no issues with buffering. The picture quality is good for not being HD. It set up super quick...less that 25 minutes and that's including accessing my accounts with Netflix, etc. The system is "intuitive" and easy to use. I only gave four stars because I really wanted one of the more advanced boxes that would give me an HD pic.
customer_reviews.author: eileen

customer_reviews.title: I got this for Fathers day and because my dad still hunts down DVD Rental stores though people always recommend shows to him on
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my parents who are a little... technologically challenged. They know how to turn on the TV and switch video inputs though, which is about all this requires. I got this for Fathers day and because my dad still hunts down DVD Rental stores though people always recommend shows to him on Netflix (which is also certainly easier and less expensive with a wider selection). I was a little worried they'd have trouble using it but it's basically fool-proof and they're enjoying shows immensely. Highly recommended for folks that want something simple for music or streaming video, without the bells and whistles.
customer_reviews.author: jimbojones

customer_reviews.title: Tired of all the tiled crap. Windows 8 sucks
customer_reviews.text: Tired of all the tiled crap. Windows 8 sucks. Google music play sucks. Give me a list view option. If I wanted the software engineers way or the company only way I'd buy apple. I don't wanna wade thru all the pretty pictures when there is a ton of crap to sort thru or search. This one seems a little faster than my 2050x. Processing power is cheap now days quit slow rolling improvements that are minor on the hardware side. The 2050x was not near as sensitive to remote input. This really has to be aimed right at it. Why are all remotes not rfid or bluetooth now days ?
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: not a competitive product in today's market
customer_reviews.text: Caught a break and got a GREAT PRICE on 2 of these devices brand new. Had previous 1st gen Rokus that finally gave up the ghost (power spikes I'm guessing since the power packs blew first despite being on surge protectors) and were not worth fixing/replacing given the price of the ROKU 1's. Out of the box and to the TV set in 5 minutes on 2 HDTVs. Overall spotty connectivity on wi-fi and no RJ45 ethernet connector on them -- very bad delivery of streamed media and Roku channels - often stuck and requires reboot - overall very disappointed and while a quick fix short term, my old ones were actually better than these new ones.
customer_reviews.author: jackbnimble

customer_reviews.title: The Family that Rokus Together...
customer_reviews.text: Roku is a video streaming device that will hook up to any TV that has at least RCA jack connections. Of course you have to have an internet connection. We hard wire the one next to the modem, but wireless connect the other Roku devices throughout the 2400 square foot two story house without issue. FYI in case you were wondering, Netflix, Amazon Prime, and other pay services allow you several devices per account. So really unless you are in love with local news, you can have netflix. amazon prime, and Hulu Plus, for around $25 a month, doing away with the need for basic cable entirely, but that's just me.
customer_reviews.author: G. E. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Roku opens up reliable contact to multitude of sources
customer_reviews.text: I had been getting access to Netflix via a couple of other mechanisms, none which worked optimally. Although the link to the internet is somtimes the source of frustration with any device using wireless, the Rokus have made it easier to seamlessly access fountains of information and input worthy stuff. I am grateful for my daughter's dexterity in setting up and guiding a baby boomer through this tech world that seems so simple and self evident to her and her ilk. Thanks also to Roku for enhancing my moments in front of the tube.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: The Roku itself is brilliant but unfortunately the remote is a piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: The Roku itself is brilliant but unfortunately the remote is a piece of crap. It doesn't keep the signal after each time you use it and is constantly losing the signal if it sits idle too long (say while you're watching a movie) and sometimes it just doesn't connect at all. I was told it was because of interference with other wifi's in my building. Basically, I'm left with using the Roku app on my phone which is annoying. My Apple TV remote never has this problem. It's a shame Roku can't make a better remote.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline E. Anthony

customer_reviews.title: I am so angry that I was sold garbage and you can be sure it will go back
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of junk. I have now spent a total of 6 hours trying to get it to work. I have been on the phone with the company twice and they have me doing all kinds of unplug, restart, check internet, router and more and still it willnot do anything it is suppose to do. I am so angry that I was sold garbage and you can be sure it will go back! I have top line router, excellent internet and it still takes a long time to load anything even before I go to a channel to pick something-then it downloads only half and stops and nothing else happens. .
customer_reviews.author: toughteach

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Streaming Solution for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I love the Roku. We now own two. The interface is simple and effective. The remote has everything you need and nothing superfluous. Setting up Netflix, Amazon, and Pandora may be a little bit of a hassle, but most of them let you go online with a code to log on rather then enter all your login information with the little Roku remote. We bought this one for our old TV that has standard RWY connectors. The only thing I wish was different about this Roku was an option for HDMI as well as RWY (for the day we eventually upgrade) but I understand that having that option would raise the price. We are Roku fans for life!
customer_reviews.author: Mom Fears My Music

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck, but think about headphones
customer_reviews.text: The Chromecast is slightly cheaper, but it doesn't have a dedicated remote and the "stick" design is just a huge mistake. This is a much better product. The streaming quality is very good, it stays connected much better to my flaky wifi than my Xbox did, and the interface feels very responsive (though it is a bit clunky, aesthetically). While I think this product is a great value, I wish I had bought the Roku 2 with the headphone jack on the remote. I didn't see the need at first, but now I kick myself at least weekly when I want to watch something with headphones.
customer_reviews.author: haggis

customer_reviews.title: Best techy purchase of the year
customer_reviews.text: So sorry Comcast! My cable broke at about the same time that I ordered this ROKU. The actual cable behind the TV is messed up, but I have not fixed it and it's been at least a couple months. I hooked up the ROKU and I can't stop watching netflix, hulu, bbc, amazon prime, tons of music stations, tons of cool indie stations... I only keep my cable hooked up b/c I need the high speed internet and it's actually cheaper to keep the Cable+internet package, than the internet only. I think Comcast is actually giving cable TV away for free to pad their cable subscriber accounts so they don't lose their butts in the stock market.
customer_reviews.author: KGranieri

customer_reviews.title: Get a Roku 3!
customer_reviews.text: I had to return my Roku 1 because it was incredibly frustrating. So SLOW and laggy when you click the buttons. Underpowered processors inside make it as responsive as a GPS from 2001. I had to hit the same buttons over and over. It's practically unusable. Hint: If you have an older TV and need a Roku with composite cables, don't get a Roku 1, get a Roku 3 and a powered HDMI to Composite converter box for about $30 from Amazon. It works like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: A.G.

customer_reviews.title: Right on Target and Worth Every Penney
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect! I have an older TV and did not think I could get a Roku box without HDMI. But this Roku 1 accommodates composite RCA jacks, as well as, HDMI. I was unpacked, setup, streaming, and browsing channel offerings in no time at all. I never even looked at the manual included. It is so simple to install and configure that anyone from 8 to 80 could do it. This little black box is everything it claims to be, I am 100% satisfied, and would highly recommend this model for anyone that wants to stream media to a non-HD TV.
customer_reviews.author: The Dirty Duke

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT INCLUDE HDMI CABLE
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is great (I got this for my dad because I have one), but they should warn you that the HDMI cable is NOT included. It does come with the red/yellow/green cord, but if you're like some of us and still also use a DVD player, you can't have both plugged in at once unless you purchase an HDMI cable separately. Seems like they could have made this clear before I gave it to my Dad and his birthday party suddenly became very anti-climactic when we realized that we would have to go to Best Buy before we could actually set it up for him.
customer_reviews.author: S. Madsen

customer_reviews.title: I love the Roku
customer_reviews.text: I love the Roku. Will buy another for my secondary tv shortly. Once I got the wireless connection figured out (in the house) worked like a charm. Don't watch much tv and am going to cut the satellite out and this gives a myriad of different channels to watch for free, although the commercials can be overbearing. However, with Netflix and maybe a few more pay sites added, I can still save money. I am very pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: greg fullmer

customer_reviews.title: I watch what I want when I want
customer_reviews.text: I cut the cord (mostly). I was tired of paying for satellite channels that I don't and never intend to watch. After researching the Roku and other streaming players, I decided on the Roku as it seemed to be the best bargain with the channels it offers. I really like it. It is easy to use and has lots of options. Now, I have to be clear here. There are many programs that are simply not available and some paid subscriptions actually only offer clips of programs and not the entire thing. I am an Amazon Prime member so I have access to many, many different shows and movies.
customer_reviews.author: Irene Zern

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for 5 years. It works perfectly, it's easy to use, zero complaints. If you misplace the remote, or run out of batteries, there is an app for your phone that is equally easy to use. I bought one for my father to use at his house as well and it's very easy even for a senior with limited eye sight to use, as there are very very few buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: Turned My TV Into a Smart TV
customer_reviews.text: The absolute best solution to my TV woes. I only have and use the Internet and now I can watch my Netflix, Hulu, and Amazon streaming movies, shows on my television. I love it! Very excellent quality for a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Donna K. Luellen

customer_reviews.title: Way too slow. Get Roku2 instead.
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up for my grandparents, they still use an old school analog tv without an HDMI port, so this was perfect for that. But the problem with it is it's just so slow, the lag time from the remote to the television is like a couple seconds. And that doesn't seem like much but when you're trying to type out a title name it's going to take you forever and gets really frustrating. If you have an old TV, go with the Roku 2. We also got one of those for them, much more responsive and more enjoyable to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 3 months and a week
customer_reviews.text: Dead after 3 months and a week. Worked great while it lasted but exactly after the warranty expired, the Roku began to overheat and would blank out. Reading the other one-star reviews about the uselessness of the Roku customer service, I decided to accept the losses (bought two) and just move on without wasting my time with the customer "service." One of the Rokus was used for less than 2 hours as it was in a guest bedroom but overheated anyway when the main one (in the bedroom) blanked out after about less than 2 hours of use per day.
customer_reviews.author: DSH

customer_reviews.title: This model perfect for my old Big Screen TV.
customer_reviews.text: This works great! We bought it for a TV so old it needs a digital converter box for OTA digital stations, but you don't need one just to watch stuff thru Roku. This model physically hooks directly to my old TV and connects wirelessly to my wifi router in another room. The Roku remote control is included but I prefer the Android app for keyboard search. I also have the Roku Streaming Stick on a newer TV and it works great too. Love Roku - tons of channels free. Also great to cast videos or movies from YouTube to your TV. Gonna cut the cable cord completely soon!
customer_reviews.author: Suzy

customer_reviews.title: Does what its supposed to!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my parents as an easy way for them to watch Netflix. Pros: -Very simple controls and design -Easy to connect to television -Takes HDMI or composite cables -Remote is easy to use Cons: -none Side note: I would heavily recommend this over late versions. Its simplicity is what makes it; in the end this is meant for streaming and is obsolete for anything else. There is no point in spending the money on more expensive variants unless you want diminishing returns
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Don't Think We Could Live Without It
customer_reviews.text: My kids and I don't get reception for regular TV and had been relying on Netflix for about 5 years until we heard about Roku, and we love it!! So, so easy to set up and use. I have even bought a second one for their room, because at 7 and 10, my girls are into different things and have trouble agreeing what to watch during their TV time. Yes, I spoil them, but at the same time, this single mom is willing to pay the extra $40-$50 for the extra receiver for some peace in the house. Plus, I use it when I am doing my arts and crafts in the room.
customer_reviews.author: Juliana P.

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to cable
customer_reviews.text: This works faster than the Apple TV. This Roku 1 is great for the older television sets. We have a seasonal cabin that we use for a couple of months during the summer. We have internet but have chosen not to get cable due to the costs and short amount of time that we are at the cabin. This is an inexpensive way of accessing our Netflix and Hulu Plus accounts. In fact, I am considering canceling cable altogether because I can watch the same television shows 1-2 days after the original broadcast with fewer commercials.
customer_reviews.author: kphaTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Love my ROKU
customer_reviews.text: As my friends & family can tell you, I LOVE MY ROKU! I thought I would miss my DVR but I dont. I also don't miss my cable bill...I shaved about $100 off of it monthly! I invested $50 for the ROKU player & $30 for an antenna (to get local channels) and there is a $25 yearly charge from ROKU. That's it. My total monthly bill is $50 for internet, $12 for HULU and $9 for CBS ...less than $80 and we have more channels than we did with cable. I don't see myself ever going back to cable.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Bowlus

customer_reviews.title: Love my Roku
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Roku 1 after moving to the country and wasn't able to get cable anymore and didn't feel like falling into a lengthy contract for satellite TV. I've found several channels that offer free viewing and am very much enjoying them. I was already a subscriber to channels such as Netflix and Hulu Plus, so nothing changed as far as pricing goes there. I'm very happy with my purchase and have recommended this product to a few of my friends who are in the same predicament as I am. Love my Roku.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Graves

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this since the beginning of 2014 no problems works well but I'm sure pretty soon I'll need to update it but at this time I have no reason to it serves its purpose for me. Quality is good
customer_reviews.author: Roger Law

customer_reviews.title: Works great when you cast from your phone ( youtube) i ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing keeps me from going insane in my room. Works great when you cast from your phone ( youtube) i mainly use the Netflix, Amazin prime apps. Theres some decent options on the channel store some even free. The software is lacking .. a little. and the speed on the interface is a little slow. Nothing that would really take away from the great functionally that this Roku provides. you can't beat this with that price.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos OrtizTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Roku1 for my older TV
customer_reviews.text: Had to get Roku 1 because of old TV that couldn't get audio through HDMI. I give this Roku1 4 out of 5 stars because the remote works well only as long as it is positioned so that you can point it directly at the Roku box and does not have interference from any other units. Will update if anything goes wrong but if you have an older tv, this Roku1 should work great for you.
customer_reviews.author: Pdachsie

customer_reviews.title: Get it... if you have the money.
customer_reviews.text: Works well, though wish it was cheaper. Can't find anything wrong with the product itself. It's pretty basic and does what you'd expect it to do. Hopefully soon all TV's will come with technology so we don't have to have things like this cluttering our homes and can just connect via internet TV's or computers etc. Wish there was better quality shows/movies out these days for this product to be super useful, perhaps one day that will change. Recommended, I guess.
customer_reviews.author: My two cents

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive streaming.
customer_reviews.text: Works just great. Not quite as fast to load as the ROKU 3, but still is more than acceptable. Also good if you need to connect analog video and audio out as it has the RCA out jacks. Great if you need to connect wireless headphones or a older audio system. It does not have a ethernet jack. Wireless only. It also does not have the audio out jack on the remote like the ROKU 3 has.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Mezo

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for my Mom and she loves it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Mom she is elderly and watches a lot of TV. Since she got this she never watches her cable TV anymore she is always streaming TV shows and movies and absolutely loves that she can watch what she wants when she wants and even pause the shows can come back the next day right to where she was. I also have one and I love mine as well, I work a lot and like to watch when I can and this makes watching my shows and movies especially on Netflix so easy. Lots of other free and pay channels so the variety is never ending. Would recommend buying this.
customer_reviews.author: L.Smith

customer_reviews.title: Kudos to Roku!
customer_reviews.text: Great product that performs well. I have access to movies, shows and other content that my cable provider will never have. Kudos to Roku. I am only giving it 4 out of 5 stars because the install instructions could have been more helpful. Due to the type of TV I have, along with my cable box, I had to call a tech friend for assistance. However, once we figured out the "configuration" of things, the set-up was easy. Would have been nicer if Roku had FAQ included esp. for users that had pre-existing technologies like a cable box,dvr,dvd,etc.
customer_reviews.author: KDW

customer_reviews.title: Do You Want To Save Money
customer_reviews.text: I love my Ruko, this is my fifth purchase of the Ruko. I put one in my family room one in my bed and give three as Christmas gifts. The only complaint I have is sometimes it goes off line. I don't think this has anything to do with the lRuko it might be the cable company , however it can be frustrating in the middle of a movie. Other than that no other complaints. I will be getting rid of most of my cable, I will just keep basic cable. Best buy I have made in a long time very happy with my Ruko 's.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Returned it
customer_reviews.text: I could not connect this to my wi-fi, and after about two hours I gave up. I don't know whether I am just stupid, or if it is not meant to connect 20' away from the modem. I never got beyond the installation, so I don't know how well it works. I decided to get a different device which connects with a cable.
customer_reviews.author: Harmon McCraw

customer_reviews.title: Get your Roku today what a great device!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing I have bought in a long time. Doesn't take up much room, works like a charm, easy to use, my 5yr. old grand-daughter uses it with ease-simple remote, not a lot of buttons. It was so easy to set up also. I wish I knew about this years ago when I first got into streaming. This device has all the Apps you could want, so many of the devices don't have the Apps I'm looking for, this has it all. I will buy it again and for a gift for family next time. When friends come over, it is always something that comes up in discussion and now they are going to check it out....Yes!
customer_reviews.author: Seawis

customer_reviews.title: Everybody needs one!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Roku device. I have one in my bedroom and one in my living room. I cancelled cable a long time ago and have not looked back. These are great and the Roku app on my Android phone works amazingly with them. You may have to occasionally reboot them but it only takes a minute. I mainly use mine with Netflix, Amazon Instant, and Plex media server.
customer_reviews.author: paboothz71

customer_reviews.title: Works good for Netflix
customer_reviews.text: All we wanted it for was Netflix so it works great for us. We don't have a smart tv or dvd player in the living room at my grandmothers house so this was the perfect way for her to be able to access Netflix. It's also very simple to operate so it was easy for her to learn how to use; she was not intimidated by the technology.
customer_reviews.author: B_Z

customer_reviews.title: however I must say I am a little disappointed in it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this only because it was cheaper than apple tv, however I must say I am a little disappointed in it. It's not as easy to use as I had hoped for. My daughter has apple tv and it is much more user friendly. I do like being able to stream netflix and hulu but I feel as though it makes the picture on my hdtv less clear. If you are looking for a cheap way to watch tv then this is the way to go. For me I'll use this on my bedroom tv, but for our living room tv I'll be investing in apple tv.
customer_reviews.author: charmed

customer_reviews.title: So convenient
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my boyfriend for Christmas, and he loves it. We replaced both his Xbox and his computer hooked up to his tv with the Roku for streaming, and it's great! Very easy to access all the different channels and easy to program new ones. I may have missed it elsewhere, but it says to get an HD cable if you have an HD tv for better viewing, and it's right. We used the regular cables it came with until we got the HD cable, and it's not horrible viewing, just looks like a regular analog tv, but if you want clearer viewing, the HD is much better.
customer_reviews.author: dhslars

customer_reviews.title: Compatible with our old TV
customer_reviews.text: I wish we had bought a Roku sooner. We were using the Wii to watch Netflix, Youtube, Prime, etc, but the Roku is so much better. Not only are there more movie streaming channels, there are a bunch of radio channels! :D It is easy to click to Netflix and Prime from the remote and the others are only a click away! This is also compatible with our super old TV!
customer_reviews.author: T L

customer_reviews.title: Some things just stop working
customer_reviews.text: I have had my ROKU for 6 months .. All I do is watch my Roku and at first the buttons stop working it would only go one direction. It wont GO DOWN so I can not select movies or go back or down. So I said it must be the batteries ..It only allows 1 direction. I have to log on my computer to adjust the shows I want to watch...Ugg .So Im researching . so I want to buy another but not sure I wonder is there another device that would be better
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Please understand if you are not already subscribed to cable and/or individual movie rental companies like Netflix, redbox
customer_reviews.text: Have had it less than a year and already broke. Please understand if you are not already subscribed to cable and/or individual movie rental companies like Netflix, redbox, etc. then this will not work. The Roku is really no different than your blu ray player. It gives you the option to sign up and PAY then watch movies. Some people who are not in tune with how this works may be in for a big surprise so buyer beware. Unless you plan to pay monthly for individual services like Netflix then don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: N. Nazifi

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: By brother mentioned Roku to me in January. I'd never heard of it but I ordered one to try it out. I was tired of watching Netflix on my laptop and wanted to watch it on my new TV. The hardest thing about the installation was getting the product unwrapped LOL! Installation is so simple and I'm not very good with electronics. I've enjoyed my Roku so much that I purchased another one for my granddaughter. I also purchased an HDMI cable separately because one doesn't come with the Roku.
customer_reviews.author: DRoss

customer_reviews.title: Finnicky little thing
customer_reviews.text: The set up was a little tedious, but tollerable. Finding channels is a bit tricky. They push you to the pay channels. It's not very dependable. After a few months it started losing its connection to the router. I find I have to reboot it regularly. Otherwise, the picture quality is very good (on a par with Cable). I suspect the speeds of signals are determined by the other devices in the chain (router, service provider, etc.) It would get a much better rating if it was more dependable.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Szava-kovats

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I'm pleased with this little unit. It is perfect for my needs, not too expensive or complicated to set up and very easy to use. All I use it for so far is to watch Amazon Prime and its perfect for that. I would mirror others displeasure at having to give Roku my credit card information considering how careless businesses seem to be in guarding this sensitive information or how very efficient and clever the crooks have become in stealing it depending on your point of view. For me it does exactly what it says it will do. I do wish I could turn it off though hence the four stars.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Roku 1 is worth buying. It is the only one that has the Video and audio connections for Vcr's ,Tv's
customer_reviews.text: I already owned one for myself but purchased another in case this one stopped working. I let my Mother use it instead of letting it sit in the box indefinitely and she loves it. She said that she hopes mine never breaks or stops working so she can keep that one.
customer_reviews.author: Deacon Willie

customer_reviews.title: It's very nearly exactly what we were hoping for!
customer_reviews.text: My family now has three Rokus and we love them all! We started out with the original purple entry models, so this one was (I thought) an upgrade for us. We're very happy with it and it's worked very well for us, just as our other two have. However, in the description it states "with rich, vibrant video streaming up to 1080p HD." I have it connected to a 1080P television, via HDMI, but it only sends a 720P stream... Maybe it's a setting I haven't discovered yet, but perhaps it's a misprint in the description. In either case, I say, keep up the great work, Roku!
customer_reviews.author: J. Bond

customer_reviews.title: not good
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered 4 I think roku's and they all run hot my husband has one I bought in oct of last year and it works great all the ones I have had run really hot and have had to send them back called roku said it was my plug in changed plug in still run hot even put them on my husbands tv and they all run hot roku still said it was not the roku's some how it was my fault do not know how?????? and I bought several different models too the only one I did not buy is roku 3 because I do not to the gaming
customer_reviews.author: TERRY W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Streamer!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a Sony for 3yrs. Honestly it was showing it age (slow speed, often hanging up) The Roku is fast, has excellent channel choices, my only complaint is that it doesn't offer You tube which is why I went with the Sony Network Media Player SMP-N100 initially. I can stream YT on my computer much faster than I can on the Sony so it's a no brainer. If you want to access/stream Netflix, Amazon Prime, Hulu, as well as other interesting content this is a great buy
customer_reviews.author: Ronald J Davis

customer_reviews.title: Still running few years later
customer_reviews.text: Got this a few years back, and it's still kicking. Doesn't update anymore but still streams like a champ
customer_reviews.author: Bria

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with the Roku not at all what I had ...
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed with the Roku not at all what I had expected. Most of the content is a available elsewhere either on a smart TV or online. Other content consists of old and out of date television shows. Access to the more popular stations such as HBO etc are not available to Canadian subscribers. Acorn TV, Netflix etc are available at an additional charge. The Acorn TV option is a cocktail of old British programming, much of which is available elsewhere. As for the device itself, it is rather primitive, much like when we rented video players to watch movies. All in all, although it was inexpensive I would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: anthea taylor

customer_reviews.title: It does everything I need and the extra cpu power of the 3 is really a waste plus I don't want games
customer_reviews.text: I got the "1" because it slightly faster than the stick and and cheaper than the 2 or 3. It does everything I need and the extra cpu power of the 3 is really a waste plus I don't want games. This is fast enough and zippy in the menus. I did not want the 2 because I don't like the wifi remote. The batteries need to be replaced all the time compared to the IR which is hardly ever. If I need a wifi remote I can use my smart phone since the Roku phone app is pretty awesome.
customer_reviews.author: rc

customer_reviews.title: For Older TV Users
customer_reviews.text: I have the older TV and have no desire to buy a HDTV when I already have one. Hookup was fast and easy. Offers a generous amount of FREE stations but carefully go through the items so you won't get charged for things you really didn't want to pay for.
customer_reviews.author: eyewrist

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is the simplest electronic device I have ever used. It installs in minutes (have your own HDMI cable ready). Follow the directions on screen to set up. Start streaming movies, TV, music. This small device just might make cable obsolete. Even the remote device is simple. I have a couple of smart TVs, but was not ready to replace all of them. I now have a couple of Roku 1s on my other TVs so that even my guests can have access to video without having to pay for a cable box in every room.
customer_reviews.author: calif golfer

customer_reviews.title: Third one we've bought
customer_reviews.text: We have dropped all the expensive premium channels since installing one of these on our main TV and are not missing them. The selection of movies and television shows through Netflix and Amazon Prime is so extensive and they add to them constantly. We've bought two others to gift our children who also are dropping a lot of cable services. An additional advantage is that in this mid term election year we are already missing all those offensive political commercials and they are just going to get worst.
customer_reviews.author: L. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what I would expect.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as my Wii kept having problems playing videos on Netflix, I kept getting the same error and I'd have to restart Netflix. This Roku works great, was easy to set up, so far I've used it for Netflix, Amazon Prime, Youtube, Spotify, and ESPN. Everything has worked perfect, except for ESPN, which has been laggy at times when watching live sports (however, this could be due to my internet provider). All the others have worked perfect, including Netflix, which is what I primarily use it for anyways. Good product, I even found an app for my wp8 phone, so I can control it with my phone and have a full keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: Cut or Eliminate your Cable bill
customer_reviews.text: The Roku is a great alternative to cable tv. With some of the new channels (Aereo) you can even receive live local broadcasts in major cities. Product was shipped on time and in great condition. Easy to set up and works great. I have now cut my cable and will try to survive with the Roku and a OTA (over the air) antennae and Aereo. Only problem is some live college sports which I will not get. Saving about $50 per month thanks to the Roku.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: WHERE has this been all my life???
customer_reviews.text: I'm one of a very small group of people refusing to throw away my still working BIG backed tvs. Thanks to me updating my iPhone (I know, the irony) in Sam's Club, the tech told me about this Roku. I can't believe my 20yr old tv is now a smart tv. Very easy to use even for those who aren't tech savvy.
customer_reviews.author: Buffy

customer_reviews.title: R>>>O>>>K>>>U>>>
customer_reviews.text: Wow what a machine. You have to be on the computer lots the first month to register all your freebies. We are trying a 'channel' a month for free movies to see which one we want to pay for. There is lots to register for your free programs. Nothing is live stream, but look forward to baseball games...Go Cardinals. Fun item and learning how to use it so we get rid ourselves of DirectTV. Go from $100.00 to $30.00 plus a movie channel like Amazon or Netflix...Thanks ROKU
customer_reviews.author: STofMO

customer_reviews.title: No brainer! Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these now and am dumping my paid TV service provider. Saves me $125/mth easy and the kids love it as well. Use this along with my Amazon Prime Instant Video which has endless amount of programs, movies, etc to watch. How can you go wrong? I have to reboot it now and then but that's not Roku's fault. that's because i live in the sticks sort of and have DSL. Streams great just the same. Would buy again and am. Getting one for every tv in the house!
customer_reviews.author: Vermonter

customer_reviews.title: glad we bought it
customer_reviews.text: After a .... year, I guess, glad we bought it. Hasn't failed and dead simple to get connected and communicating with the router at the computer. We bought the stick unit for the bedroom TV and it also is working reliably. It would be better if a volume control was on the Roku remote. That's why we have to have the TV remote handy.
customer_reviews.author: LumEtters

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this product
customer_reviews.text: As a college student, I needed something I could watch Netflix and Hulu on, and for cheap. This Roku is the way to go. First of all, it's ridiculously simple to use and set up. It took me all of 5 minutes. Plugging in my wifi password was the most time consuming part. I can watch all of my shows whenever I want. Plus, it moves easily, so if I want to use it on a different tv, I just unplug it. This model is very simple, but it does the trick!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: awesome little thing
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this thing for netflix, hulu, youtube, TED, and many others for over a year now. I LOVE this little thing. It is cheap and effective. My favorite part is that i can control it with the app on my phone through the wifi so I dont ever lose the remote!!
customer_reviews.author: Nate Fuller

customer_reviews.title: netflix on this only access the first profile, be ...
customer_reviews.text: netflix on this only access the first profile, be aware of that if you share accounts with someone and have seperate profiles to organize shows, movies, etc. on netflix
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Nieves

customer_reviews.title: Composite video output for very old TVs
customer_reviews.text: Although response is slower than later models, the Roku1 has a composite video output for older TVs, DVD recorders and VCRs if anyone still uses them. Quality is understandably reduced when using composite out but full HDMI is also available for HD. Note, this unit can only use WiFi as there is no wired LAN input available. Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: G. Pomeroy

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: It can take forever to boot up, but it works well. Image is crisp and it connects to the Wifi dependably. I'm very satisfied. Missing one star because it included a Fox News app pre-installed. I deleted it right away, but it would be nice just to have entertainment options by default and not such a hyper-political channel like Fox (or MSNBC if they'd included that). I use it primarily with Hulu and Netflix, but have used YouTube, but only when paired with my smart phone or computer. Searching for a youtube video is a pain using the remote. But pairing is really easy.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D.

customer_reviews.title: A Great Find!
customer_reviews.text: I am not the most techno-savvy person but this was a no-brainer. I can now easily use services I already pay for (Amazon Prime and Netflix) and I am ready to disconnect my expensive cable provider. This device connected like a dream (buy the recommended HDMI cable) and I was using it within a few minutes. These services are available in gaming systems already but the price really makes this technology affordable without having to have the expensive system.
customer_reviews.author: Rae York

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and hook up
customer_reviews.text: I am older and did not think I would like this, but I do. It downloads so quickly. The only thing I have noticed is that it does not turn off which is really not so green. I hooked it up to an extension cord to eliminate this problem which looks stupid. Also the remote is this tiny little thing, and I personally would prefer something weightier. Now, last week Roku I understand came out with a stick that you hook up to your port on your TV eliminating this so check into that.
customer_reviews.author: C Faith

customer_reviews.title: Rudimentary
customer_reviews.text: I just picked up the Roku 1 to play with and found it very rudimentary, but it works on a 50Mbps connection after a lot of patience. It’s a little sad to think that this is what TV in the U.S. is coming to, but until the cable companies stop their slow suicide and stand up to the content companies and refuse to force their customers to pay for loads and loads of crap that they never watch, it’s good to start looking at other alternatives, I guess. (Please excuse the political commentary.)
customer_reviews.author: llewon

customer_reviews.title: ... stream via our blu ray payer with sketchy and annoying results. This little baby allows us to access ...
customer_reviews.text: We've been attempting to stream via our blu ray payer with sketchy and annoying results. This little baby allows us to access our Netflix and Amazon accounts with little fuss -- even my wife can deal with it (admittedly with typed out instructions -- I kid you not!) which makes this one a winner. Yeah, we're late to the game and this has been around a long time, but better late than never, right?
customer_reviews.author: Filmdoc2001

customer_reviews.title: Sad and bored in Green Bay
customer_reviews.text: It hasn't worked well since the first week. I thought it was my internet connection so I worked with my provider to see if I couldn't get it to work better and by the time I realized it was the box it was passed the date that I could return it so now I'm stuck. Sad. I know it's not my internet because I can watch Netflix, Hulu and Amazon on my computer judt fine but it constantly freezes up on this roku.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Terrific piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: It works beautifully. I gave it four stars because sometimes in the watching something the screen will freeze and it seems to take forever to get a response from the box. Now whether this is due to the internet connection or roku itself, is a mystery to me but it's annoying. :) This is my third roku and I will recommend this to everyone I know.
customer_reviews.author: Glass Artist

customer_reviews.title: Great little streamer
customer_reviews.text: After doing some research on what my options would be for an old office TV once our cable company decided to go all digital. I decided the Roku was my best option and bought the least expensive model just in cas I didn't like it. Turns out it is exactly what I needed. Easy set up, easy user interface and tons of channels to choose from. I actually liked it so much I bought a second one. Nice streaming device.
customer_reviews.author: LJW

customer_reviews.title: Very (gladly) surprised!
customer_reviews.text: Have an Apple TV for the family room, but decided to pick up a Roku for my master bedroom. I decided to purchase the Roku 1 instead of the newest device because my TV's HDMI port has begun acting up, and thankfully, this device offers both an HDMI out as well as an RCA option (yellow/white/red). I've been extremely happy with the quality of the device itself, as well as the programming and channels available. Great little product!
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: The Roku works good, but sometimes a bit slow and a great deal of the programs have commercials. Don't waste your money on MLB, you can't watch most of the games in your area live. It is easy to operate. A four year old and a six year old use it easily. It's probably worth your money if you don't have good cable service in your area or can't afford satellite. Depending on the time and day, it can be so slow it's almost not worth messing with.
customer_reviews.author: Lavo

customer_reviews.title: Works great but I miss channels available on my Roku 3
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Roku 1 for my bedroom television. It works fast, loads and streams just as well as my Roku 3. My only complaint is that there are channels (in my case, You Tube) that are not available on the Roku 1 that are available on the Roku 3 and it is very hard on my 4 year old that he cannot watch his favorite You Tube videos (the Numberjacks) while in mommy's room. Had I known, I would have forked over the extra money for a Roku 3 but otherwise, for the value, the Roku 1 works great.
customer_reviews.author: S. Day

customer_reviews.title: You won't be sorry
customer_reviews.text: I really didn't think there would be much of a difference in streamers, but after getting this one I am so impressed. I had to get rid of my old one because I couldn't get Amazon Prime on it. So now I have both and what a difference in streamers as well as the difference between Netflix and Amazon Prime. With family coming for an extended stay this summer I am so glad for us to have something to watch in the evening after a busy summer day. By the way, set up is very easy with this streamer. The directions are very clear and concise..
customer_reviews.author: Lynn G

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with playon and within 10 minutes, I had it up and running. I didn't really like being forced to set up an account with a credit card. That should be an option. I also wish the user interface when searching through personal media on my computer was better. I prefer to see a whole page of titles and have the option to skip through rather than the item by item view used in Roku. Over all, I'm happy with my purchase and recommend it for use with playon.
customer_reviews.author: Noel Saabye

product_meta.title: Roku 1 Streaming Media Player (2710R)
product_meta.description: The Roku 1 is the best basic player money can buy. Enjoy stunning video at up to 1080p HD* . Roku 1 comes standard with composite cables just in case your TV doesn't have HDMI. Enjoy more than 2,000 streaming channels, offering access to 250,000+ movies and TV episodes, plus, music, sports, international programming, kids programming and more*. Search the widest selection of channels by title, actor, or director. Follow new movies you want to watch, and receive automatic updates when they are ready to stream. *Some channels require payment. Channel availability can change and varies by country. Availability of 1080p HD video limited by channel provider and speed of broadband connection.
feature_bullets: Perfect for HD and 4K Ultra HD TVs, features fast quad core processor and 802.11AC dual band wireless
Exceptionally brilliant picture quality. 4k ultra hd at 60fps with four times the resolution of 1080p hd
Vibrant HDR displaying an incredible range of colors, brighter whites, and deeper blacks
Fully loaded with digital audio output, convenient point anywhere remote with voice search and remote finder, headphones for private listening, and gaming controls
Dolby audio and Dolby ATMOS pass through over HDMI
